intro: Euphrasia rostkoviana var. onegensis, commonly known as the Onegian eyebright, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of southern Russia and northern Caucasus. It belongs to the Scrophulariaceae family and is characterized by its small, yellowish-orange flowers that bloom in early summer. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and thrives in alpine or subalpine environments. It has hairy, lance-shaped leaves and is often found in open, sunny habitats. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species in some regions.
